recommendations: Narayanamurthy Tadepalli ‚ÄúI had the privilege to work with Tejasvi over the last three months and collaborate with Tejasvi in the Data Governance office. I've seen Tejasvi is someone who thrives on embracing challenges, always striving to ensure the success of our internal clients. Pratap Komatiguntla ‚ÄúTejasvi is an advent expert in data management and governance. He is an excellent leader and his mentorship steers data management in the Bank, towards outcomes. publications.title: Right time to create/improvise the data governance maturity model?
publications.subtitle: finextra
publications.description: There is no one model fits all for maturity assessment. Maturity model is a powerful technique that can be leveraged by organizations to help assess themselves against external and internal benchmarks. If an executive starts reading a report, he might lose his interest in 15 minutes. Rather than having the stakeholders go through the complete report, a quantitative assessment that says 3.5 against risk governance can help them understand where the organization or division stands.

publications.title: Choosing the Right Model for Operational Data Governance Initiatives
publications.subtitle: Dataversity
publications.description: To embark on data governance in an enterprise that spans divisions and diverse stakeholders, a well-defined operating model plays a vital role in achieving expected business benefits.

publications.title: Overcome common Data Governance challenges that your organization faces right now
publications.subtitle: finextra

publications.title: Heralding Next Generation Banking with Social Media
publications.subtitle: Infosys Limited
publications.description: Innovation in social features is soon to become mainstream amongst all North American banks with considerable increase in investments on technology and infrastructure. At the same time, banks in other regions are also luring customers with ‚Äòhard to stay away‚Äô sticky features. Financial institutions are rolling their sleeves to shed the hitherto conservative image and adopt a fresh look that appeals to ever changing consumer preferences.

publications.title: Data Governance is now a new normal but with Big Data?
publications.subtitle: Finextra
publications.description: There are enterprise horns honking the words that Big Data has the potential to drive Banking to a novel era. Being a millennial and an avid believer of business transformation driven by technology, I don‚Äôt think twice on a positive nod for this aspect.

publications.title: A BOON but not a Baboon in Credit scoring landscape
publications.subtitle: Finextra

publications.title: Gamification: Play banking
publications.subtitle: Global Finance
publications.description: Banks have come a long way in shifting their focus from the traditional branch banking channel to online banking. The initial websites were built for banks to host static data and provide information. With the onset of the banking transaction wave, an entire generation of products and services were made available online, thereby enabling customers to bank anytime, anywhere.Presently, the banking industry is going through a paradigm shift, with banks adopting social media not just to gauge customer satisfaction, but as an alternate, prime banking channel. What comes next is uncertain, but one significant trend that is rapidly gaining traction is gamification.

publications.title: Web 3.0 ‚Äì innovate banking and transform customer experience
publications.subtitle: Infosys
publications.description: A banking website is not simply a channel for disseminating product information. It has evolved significantly and now has the capacity to source, retain, and furthermore, educate... mortgage borrowers. An ideal banking application must provide a favorable online customer experience. It needs to respond to the borrower‚Äôs thoughts and behavior rather than merely execute pre-programmed functions. The good news is that Web 3.0 can help you achieve this state.

publications.title: Do we need a mature Gap Analysis
publications.subtitle: Business Anayst Times
publications.description: How many agree that the Scope for a business analysis has moved from the silos of applications to a strategic level. The boundaries of business analysis have stretched to greater ranges starting from the strategy analysis to business change management. The same was not expected from a business analyst a few years back.

publications.title: HDFC Bank's creal Technology Taxonomy
publications.subtitle: Banking Frontiers
publications.description: Munish Mittal, CIO and group head-IT, HDFC Bank, says the bank is now preparing to adopt technologies of the future. In an interaction with Banking Frontiers, he says he would prefer to divide these into two:‚ÄúThe first is hygiene technologies. Here, we are talking about scale. We do over a billion and half transactions in a month, out of which ~85% are digital. These have to be persisted in a system of records and availability of information means a lot to us. We are therefore investing heavily in building the next generation of scale such as infrastructure scale, cloud scale, internet scale, infinite scale. We have begun our journey of agile with adoption of DevOps and technologies like Dockers and Kubernetes to build infinite scale. Similarly, elasticity is required to expand and collapse depending on workloads and seasonality. The period from Janmashtami to Diwali is the highest consumption period for consumer durables, auto loans, etc. Handling this would require a scale up from 2500 to 5000 to 10,000 transactions per second. And this would need adoption of technologies like cloud, Dockers, Kubernetes, etc. We are rewriting our applications to be cloud native.‚ÄùHe continues: ‚ÄúThe second is availability. At HDFC Bank, we are all obsessed with availability. Illustratively, we have invested on running our RTGS application in Active-Active mode from across 2 data centers. We have about 18% RTGS volume across the country. As much as roughly 36% of the country‚Äôs daily money settlement payments processing passes though HDFC Bank and another bank. We need to be highly available. We have worked with IFTAS/IDRBT and reengineered the RTGS system. For core banking, we have a 3-way DR between the primary site, the DR site and the near site. We are investing a lot in our DR/BCP practice to ensure zero data loss for core banking ‚Äì perhaps the only Indian bank today running zero RPO on Core banking from DR/BCP perspective.‚Äù

publications.title: Cisco India Summit 2018: Robust network is the primary prerequisites of digital banking, says HDFC Bank CIO & Group Head ‚Äì IT Munish Mittal
publications.subtitle: THE TECH OBSERVER
publications.description: With HDFC Bank digital transactions growing from 63% to over 80% in the last three years. The banks focus on technology has increased like never before. At Cisco India Summit 2018 in Goa, bank‚Äôs Chief Information Officer & Group Head ‚Äì Information Technology, Munish Mittal presented the broad overview of technology intervention at the HDFC Bank.He said that with the proliferation of mobile devices, consumer expectations of digital banking have increased manifold. He was of the view that customers expect to complete their transactions anytime and anywhere, through different channels. He informed that to meet the ever-evolving customer demand, HDFC Bank powered its backend infrastructure with Cisco‚Äôs networking solutions. Mittal informed that HDFC Bank data center which is built on Cisco Unified Computing Systems (UCS), leverages Cisco Nexus Datacenter switches to reduce cost and complexity through automation, analytics, and energy management.He said that the bank is looking beyond core banking to delight its customers. Tele-Sales is one of the important channels that HDFC Bank uses to maximize on the cross-sell and up-sell opportunities that they have in the market. Within the HDFC Bank‚Äôs contact center, Cisco Contact Center Solution delivers intelligent routing and call treatment, network-to-desktop computer telephony integration, and omnichannel contact management. Also, with the help of predictive dialing, agents can now make almost 1.5 X more sales calls every month.Cisco informed that HDFC Bank has commenced the implementation of Cisco‚Äôs next-generation security solution Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) to protect and manage its IT infrastructure and provide endpoint security across 4,787 branches ‚Äì making it the largest deployment in the Asia-Pacific and Japan region (APJ).

I am a strong advocate for cybersecurity training and building cross-functional teams that collaborate effectively to mitigate risks and solve challenges.

recommendations: Vinod Chandaliya ‚ÄúI've had the pleasure of collaborating with Devang Sir on multiple deployment and infrastructure projects. Although we haven't worked directly, I've been impressed by his exceptional technical expertise, process-oriented approach, and practical problem-solving skills. Devang possesses a deep understanding of products, spanning business requirements, development, infrastructure, and delivery. He's an outstanding leader who provides clear direction and guidance, empowering teams to choose the right methodologies for their work. His collaborative approach and willingness to listen enable him to find common ground, ensuring solutions that work for everyone. I highly recommend Devang Sir for his technical acumen, leadership abilities, and dedication to delivering exceptional results.‚Äù

Rohit Dubey ‚Äú I had the privilege of working with Devang for three years at HDFC Limited. During this time, I had the opportunity to work on multiple projects under his guidance and gained a wealth of knowledge and experience. Devang is an exemplary leader and mentor. His deep understanding of the technical and managerial aspects of our projects was instrumental in our success. He consistently provided clear direction, valuable insights, and unwavering support. His ability to break down complex problems and provide actionable solutions is truly commendable. One of the key strengths of Devang is his commitment to fostering a collaborative and productive work environment. He encouraged open communication and ensured that every team member's voice was heard and valued. This inclusive approach not only boosted our team morale but also significantly enhanced our collective problem-solving capabilities. Under his leadership, I was able to work on a variety of projects, each presenting unique challenges and learning opportunities. Devang's mentorship played a crucial role in my professional growth, helping me develop my skills in ASP.NET, Devexpress,Oracle Sql,SSRS, Netcore and other technologies. His guidance enabled me to take on more responsibilities and contribute effectively to our projects. Devang is a strategic thinker with a keen eye for detail. His ability to anticipate potential issues and proactively address them ensured that our projects were delivered on time and to the highest standards. His dedication to continuous improvement and innovation inspired the entire team to strive for excellence.‚Äù

recommendations: Sharad Jain ‚ÄúIt has been a pleasure to work with Vineet. I have personally seen him grow from a .net developer to .net architect to all his experience in Data Engineering and Data Science, always fully committed to learning and his growth. You will be assured of the success of the program if Vineet is leading it on technology and engineering, producing the best solution architecture and successful quality outcomes. The same he expects from the team and helps mentor and grow them making him a great people leader as well.‚Äù

Amit Xerxes ‚ÄúVineet is a strong technologist and a solid Solution Architect for Data, AI and ML applications. I had the pleasure of working very closely with Vineet for nearly a year at Publicis Sapient. Vineet was the primary Architect on the ML / AI solutions track for a large Global Consumer Products client, where we were implementing a number of NLP (natural language processing) solutions to infuse Content Intelligence across the various brand experiences. Vineet played a key role in architecting and designing the solution on the AWS Cloud, and managing and leading a team of Data Engineers, Data Scientists, and API Developers towards successful delivery of the solutions. He also collaborated with Front-End Devs, Cloud and Infra and DevOps Leads, and Client Data Science leads, and Client Infra consultants to successfully integrate and deploy the solution onto Production. Throughout the journey, Vineet demonstrated high learnability, strong commitment, a passion for the technology and the work, and tremendous collaboration across a cross-disciplinary team to ensure quality delivery. Vineet is very passionate about Data, AI and ML solutions in particular, and is able to stitch the full solution together from the front-end CX to the back-end data pipelines, processing, data modelling, and API integration. He was himself hands-on with a number of the solution elements, but also was deep into the details of the data pipelines and the ML models, that were at the heart of the solution. A strong Data Solution Architect with a great attitude, and a very humble human being. Would love to work with him again!‚Äù

detailed_profile.name: Pallavi Bhargava
detailed_profile.position: AVP - Visual Design, HDFC Digital Factory | 100+ art workshops and exhibitions
detailed_profile.about: Currently building a pixel perfect digital experience at Hdfc, trying to bring a efficient and impactful difference to around 120 million individuals and counting. . As an ambitious and well-rounded graphic designer, making pixels, colors, and lines talk is what I do best. My work combines graphic design, illustration, identity design, and branding to tell stories that educate and inspire. I have hands-on experience with design softwares such as Adobe Illustrator, Photoshop, and Indesign. Having an immense passion for painting, I express my thoughts through my artworks in as many mediums, and share my passion for illustrations by penning down my day to day thoughts via Instagram. A strong work culture along with a workplace which lets you have freedom of thoughts and ideas is what I believe in.

recommendations: LinkedIn User ‚ÄúPallavi embodies raw enthusiasm, and it's infectious! You can count on her to take on ambitious projects with gusto, and she commits to delivering fresh design that meets your goal. She actively seeks criticism, is a great listener, and is always challenging herself. Pallavi's talent and creativity extends far beyond her regular workday - she manages to find inspiration all around her and is always working on amazing new designs for businesses, friends, and her own pet projects. You can count on her to bring ownership and dedication - even in the wee hours of the night - to every project she undertakes. I've no doubt that she will be a force to reckon with in the design world!‚Äù

publications.title: HDFC Bank Launches Digital Loans Against Mutual Funds
publications.subtitle: Business News Trends
publications.description: In a first in the country, HDFC Bank launched its Digital Loans against Mutual Funds (LAMF), in partnership with transfer agent CAMS. Customers can now pledge mutual fund assets online and get overdraft limit set in their account in under 3 minutes. They can now avail of this product through the HDFC Bank website in 3 easy steps. With this product, customers can leverage their mutual fund (MFs) portfolio to avail funds for any contingencies or emergencies without liquidating their investments or stopping their regular investment plans/SIPs. Digital Loans against Mutual Funds is available for resident Indians and for portfolios that are individual holdings.

experience.title: India Economist
experience.description: Part of the Corporate CRISIL Economic Research team. Involved in forecasting macro economic variables for the Indian economy and working on broader macro themes.Areas of interest : Trade, Monetary Policy and Labour market.
experience.description_html:
Part of the Corporate CRISIL Economic Research team. Involved in forecasting macro economic variables for the Indian economy and working on broader macro themes.
Areas of interest : Trade, Monetary Policy and Labour market.

experience.title: European Economist
experience.description: I worked in the European Team in HSBC Global Banking and Markets as an economist. Research Interests in Labour market, Periphery economies and International TradeI was involved in building models to forecast macro economic variables and predict monetary policy rate calls for the Norway economy. I have also done rigorous econometric modelling for thematic reports on German inflation, Spain labour market and convergence indicators. My exposure at HSBC has taught me the importance of presentation and how to effectively transform conclusions and ideas from data into marketable actions. At HSBC, I learnt to adapt myself to different languages, cultures and work ethics and I think this is one of my biggest assets.

publications.title: Should Britain Leave the EU?: An Economic Analysis of a Troubled Relationship
publications.subtitle: Edward Elgar, Cheltenham, UK ‚Ä¢ Northampton, MA, USA, with the Institute of Economic Affairs
publications.description: This book brings a thorough review of all economic aspects of the UK's relationship with the EU, which also puts it in the political context of the upcoming referendum. It notes the intention of the EU to move to 'ever closer union' and the nature of the regulatory and general economic philosophy of the dominant countries of the EU whose writ is enforced by qualified majority voting. The book highlights the UK dilemma that, while extending free markets to its local region is attractive, this philosophy and intended union are substantially at odds with the UK's traditions of free markets and freedom under the common law.

publications.title: Check for cereal offenders
publications.subtitle: Times of India
publications.description: Monsoon has had a delayed start this year, and the risk of it failing has been rising since April when the Indian Meteorological Department released its first forecast. IMD updated itself in June, forecasting a 38% chance of a sub-normal monsoon and a 70% probability of an El Nino event this year. El Nino, which occurs at irregular intervals, weakens the Asian monsoon, often causing drought in the crucial northwest and central India, and heavy rainfall (or even floods) in the northeast. Problem is, northwest and central India produce nearly two-thirds of India's foodgrains. The probability of rains coming up short has also increased the upside risks to inflation. In fiscal 2010, which saw inadequate rains, food inflation soared to 15%. To help RBI achieve the target of 8% inflation by March 2015, government needs to pitch in with proactive steps to control food inflation. Here is what we would like them to do.

publications.title: Pump up the volume
publications.subtitle: Crisil Research
publications.description: Falling domestic value-added component means a stiff exports goal is needed to boost job creation.

publications.title: What a Waste!
publications.subtitle: Crisil Research
publications.description: Where a third of fruits and vegetables produced is lost‚Ä¶Where the procurement & storage cost of grains is more than half its MSP... Nothing less than an overhaul of the farm-to-fork ecosystem and a simultaneous ramp-up in production will bring food inflation down structurally. India‚Äôs granaries continue to overflow but food inflation has averaged 8.1% in the last decade, and over 10% in recent times. This is despite agriculture growth surging to 3.6% in the last ten years from 2.9% in the decade before. So that thesis about food inflation being high because supply is struggling to catch up with demand has little grains of truth.Indeed, India needs to crank up agricultural productivity for its long-term good, but that is actually the secondary mission. The primary one is to be able to improve its supply chains and reduce wastage and pilferage. This is the biggest challenge for the new government in its battle to bring down food inflation. In our report, we suggest what needs to be done to remedy this.

publications.title: Balance short term risks with growth
publications.subtitle: Financial Express
publications.description: FY15 might just prove a game-changer for the Indian economy, what with the new government ready to take order. The government¬ís ¬ìto do¬î list is a long one. It must urgently announce policy and administrative measures that improve the investment climate and boost growth. And it must do so while addressing the risks unfolding now. A decisive election mandate has provided it the ability to address these issues more effectively.

volunteer_experience.info: There was no degree college in my native town MAUR, BATHINDA ‚Äì Punjab, hence saw a dream to have a college in Maur in 1992 when few students were thrown from the top of a bus. Took initiative and successfully completed the task with the help of fellow students & residents of the town. Today not only students of Maur go to college in their own town, but the whole Punjab comes to this upgraded Punjabi University Regional Center. This gives me immense satisfaction.

recommendations: Manu Tiwari ‚ÄúMr. Anand Sankararaman possesses a multidimensional personality with various colours. He has vast knowledge of fields related to Information Technology especially IT infrastructure (both hardware and software). Continuous self- evolution is inherent trait of his character and he has been growing continuously in knowledge in theoretical and practical manner. He also possesses superior management, organizing and interpersonal skills‚Äô expertise. Mr. Anand can tackle the situations that come to him in the same manner of an expert handles the situation. He ensures the issue that comes to him is either resolved or a probable solution is given. As he has worked at the grass root level so the troubleshooting of issues of all types that come are resolved quickly and in the best possible manner. Apart from the above Mr. Anand always takes care that every team member enjoys the fruits of his or her hard work. He believes that credit should be the domain of who deserves it. The knowledge transfer skills that Mr. Anand has are really deep, great & sound. His blends of theory and practical are very innovative. If someone approaches Mr. Anand with any problem being faced in the task then the person would get a definite solution and also new areas of thought and knowledge. He learns and knows very well when to strike and how to strike. He also ensures that when expected results are being delivered to him the team member also gets the fruits of the labour and also their area of knowledge increases. For making this happen Mr. Anand himself gives tips and knowledge increasing vision and view to subordinates.‚Äù

Subhash Kothari ‚ÄúAnand is a great person by heart. I am a technical person who joined HDFC Bank for sometime but spent 9 years with HDFC Bank. One of the factors effecting that was my Supervisor Anand. When he used to send business users to me for solutions, he used to say a lot of positive things about me. This used to help me by getting lot of confidence from the user comunity. They used to later on tell me what Anand told about me. After this kind of motivation working with Anand used to be never about getting good ratings at the end of the year, altough I used to be always satisfied with that part also. I miss a supervisor like Anand and he is the best supervisor I had till now.‚Äù

creating a healthy culture by developing Performance Review Model for performer & non-performerSkills: ‚Ä¢	Skilled at handling entire employee life cycle (Manpower Planning to Exit)‚Ä¢	Team leader with strong planning, communication, grooming skills for juniors / freshers ‚Ä¢	Designing Compensation specially Variable Pay Packages, Retention Bonus strategy over long term, Salary negotiations‚Ä¢	Well-versed with the concepts of SAP HRM Operations (including PA30, PA 40, PB 30 & ZTE Salary) and Hiring, Joining & Salary ModulesHighlights:‚Ä¢	Talent Acquisition ‚Äì Responsible for closures within timelines and mass hirings for new launch for all functions and primarily for Editorial and Sales‚Ä¢	Finalizing Master Appraisal Sheet, forming Bell Curve dept. wise across the organization and calculating letters & incentives as per grid‚Ä¢	Annual Manpower planning /budgeting, monthly costings on hirings and their comparison with allotted budgets, Contractual manpower management, Vendors management‚Ä¢	Trainings - On-Boarding and Joining , Orientation and Induction module, Policies‚Ä¢	Management Reports‚Ä¢	Employee Background reference screening ‚Äì Employment and Education details
experience.description_html:
CORE COMPETENCIES

• Defining & designing Job Description & KRAs for varied roles across functions
• Mass Hirings at the time of launch of new channels
• Identifying training needs through needs analysis, appraisal forms, on-job recommendations and designing programmes
• Imparting On Ground Training sessions after checking existing level of competencies,
• Competitive benchmarking for key roles in industry, mapping talent/potential within the organization and keeping a pool of such candidates for future hires

• Ability to design Org structures for launching new depts, manpower planning after need analysis
• Handling annual appraisal (Balanced Scorecard and 9 Blocker model) : by establishing framework to substantiate performance system linked to awards (previous data analytics); creating a healthy culture by developing Performance Review Model for performer & non-performer


Skills:
• Skilled at handling entire employee life cycle (Manpower Planning to Exit)
• Team leader with strong planning, communication, grooming skills for juniors / freshers
• Designing Compensation specially Variable Pay Packages, Retention Bonus strategy over long term, Salary negotiations
• Well-versed with the concepts of SAP HRM Operations (including PA30, PA 40, PB 30 & ZTE Salary) and Hiring, Joining & Salary Modules
Highlights:
• Talent Acquisition – Responsible for closures within timelines and mass hirings for new launch for all functions and primarily for Editorial and Sales
• Finalizing Master Appraisal Sheet, forming Bell Curve dept. wise across the organization and calculating letters & incentives as per grid
• Annual Manpower planning /budgeting, monthly costings on hirings and their comparison with allotted budgets, Contractual manpower management, Vendors management
• Trainings - On-Boarding and Joining , Orientation and Induction module, Policies
• Management Reports
• Employee Background reference screening – Employment and Education details

projects.title: ‡§™‡§æ‡§† ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§æ‡§Ç‡§∂: - Hindi text Summarization using NLP and Language models
projects.description: This project aims to tackle the growing need for text summarization systems that are tailored for Hindi text. The project takes a comprehensive approach by utilizing a combination of extractive and abstractive methods to generate concise summaries.Extractive methods involve identifying important sentences or phrases from the original text and assembling them to create a summary. One such technique used in this project is TF-IDF (Term Frequency-Inverse Document Frequency), which determines the relevance of words or phrases in a document based on their frequency across the document and the entire corpus. By ranking sentences according to their TF-IDF scores, the system can select the most salient ones for inclusion in the summary.Another extractive method employed in this project is Text Rank. Inspired by Google's PageRank algorithm, Text Rank treats sentences as nodes in a graph, with edges representing the relationships between sentences. By calculating the importance of each sentence based on the number and quality of its connections, the system can extract the most significant sentences for the summary.In addition to extractive techniques, the project also incorporates abstractive methods for generating summaries. Abstractive methods involve understanding the meaning of the text and generating new sentences that capture the essence of the original content. T5 and BART are two state-of-the-art models that excel in abstractive text generation. T5 (Text-to-Text Transfer Transformer) is a versatile model that can be fine-tuned for various natural language processing tasks, including text summarization. BART (Bidirectional and Auto-Regressive Transformers) is a model specifically designed for sequence generation tasks and has shown promising results in text summarization.

projects.title: Application of Mathematical Techniques in Computed Tomography
projects.description: To understand the role of Linear Algebra in Computed Tomography.To understand the different methods of Image reconstruction models in Computed Tomography using purely Linear Algebraic techniques.To compare the different methods based on their reconstructed images and try to reduce the errors while searching for better methods.To identify the problems associated with each method and try to overcome in the next method.

projects.title: Financial Literacy
projects.description: We conducted a survey to collect our data while using snowball sampling techniques,By using COCHRAN‚ÄôS FORMULA for sample size, we required 206 data points at least, at 95% confidence interval and 5% marginal error, we also set our objectives before the survey, and they are given below.OBJECTIVES: -1)To Understand the Impact of Socio-Demographic Factors on Financial Literacy Scores.2)To Observe the Modes Of Gaining Financial Knowledge.3)To Assess the Impact Of Family And Peers On The Investment Patterns Of The Sample.4)To Assess whether Financial Literacy Scores Has An Impact On Investment Patterns, i.e., whether Being Financial Literate Impacts The Investment Choices Of A Person. After the analysis we could conclude the following,CONCLUSIONS: -1)Financial Literacy scores are surprisingly not affected by your Age, Gender or Working Status (that is whether you are a student or working professional).2)It is highly affected by factors like your interaction with family and Peers, Locality, how much time and resources that you spend on Self Learning etc.

projects.title: Sarve Santu Nirmaya
projects.description: OBJECTIVE: The primary objective of this study is to gauge the psychological impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on the Health Care Workers (HCW). This study would also explore and identify which sub-groups within the HCW are prone to psychological distress as well as identify the risks and protective factors associated with the HCW population‚Äôs mental health.PRELIMINARY WORKS:Based on a pilot survey (n=70), we obtained the following results:‚óè The impact of PTSD (Post Traumatic Stress Disorder) on different groups within HCW are the same irrespective of their age and gender.‚óè Stress, anxiety, and depression levels are likely to be more for Healthcare workers who live with their families.‚óè Nurses are the most affected among all categories of Healthcare Workers.EXPECTED OUTCOMES:‚óè To obtain the level of mental health illness severity amongst different groups of Health-care Workers.‚óè Find the coping mechanisms employed by Health-care workers to best tackle the situation. OBJECTIVE/HYPOTHESIS:‚óè To study the severity of mental health issues amongst Health-care workers.‚óè To study the level of severity of mental health issues based on different occupations.‚óè To study the coping mechanism of Health-Care Workers.‚óè A comparative study of family physicians and Doctors working in COVID-19.

detailed_profile.name: Jeetesh Patel
detailed_profile.position: MBA- Sr. VP- HDFC Bank Ltd,
detailed_profile.about: Next100- Future CIO-Winner-2015- Head IT- Digital Transformation Leaders. Jeetesh Patel is an Engineering Graduate with MBA with over 14 years of rich experience in cross-functional areas, including IT Strategy & Policy Planning, IT Project Management, Systems Design and Implementation, with reputed group companies & leading IT consulting / service companies. Implementation of Cloud solution like Azure, AwS & private cloud. Good knowledge of VMWare & HyperV. Familiar with core banking technologies Flex Cube & FinWare. Security Management ,but also creating a Platform for business innovations thru collaborative communication setup and process transformations for making it more cost effective and more efficient on various aspects of product offerings , services, internal and external customer communications . Expertise in assisting corporate in their Endeavour to manage heterogeneous process innovation, change management and technology adaptation. Currently engaged in the role of Vice President for INDIA's Leading Bank- HDFC Bank. HEAD Data Centre, DC Infra, IT Projects and IT Support for 90,000+ users PAN India. Responsible for end user compliance for PCI DSS, patches & software deployment. Have also worked with Hewlett Packard in the capacity of Account Delivery Manager- ADM for WELSPUN Group, Bank of India & Bank of Baroda. General Manager for Welspun group of companies having a Global responsibility of Asia (Corporate responsibilities and all Manufacturing locations in India and Middle East), Europe(UK/Portugal) ,US(Five locations including two manufacturing units), Mexico(Manufacturing location) and Portugal(Manufacturing location) countries for IT Infrastructure Planning and Implementation. Responsible for IT Infrastructure & Network Uptime & BCP of 24 locations for Welspun Group Companies for and implementing the same including creation of Primary and secondary Data centers for BCP and Disaster recovery, IT security solutions, Specialties: Project Management. IT Infrastructure, BCP, Data Center, Network Technologies (TCP, BGP, OSPF, WAN, MPLS, & LAN) IT Budget OPEx & CAPEx, Negotiations & Procurements

positions.title: Account Delivery Manager
positions.description_html:
As an ADM I am Responsible for making sure that anything and
everything related to HP support works exactly as it should be.
•Leads the HP Support delivery team through efficient and effective delivery of services by managing issues in order to limit their impact to your business. To help enhance the overall availability and performance of Customer environment, as well as optimize client satisfaction, also develop a culture of continuous improvement. The goal is to keep issues that occur once from happening again
• Manages Customer expectations by developing performance metrics and reporting, plus escalation management and communication plans. Clients are kept aware of how well HP is meeting the goals that have been established to keep their IT environment operating at its best
• Takes a leadership role in the transformation of reactive service and support delivery into a strategic, high-touch, personalized customer support relationship.
To works closely with customer to make sure the support you get matches the support you need and expect.
Key Responsibilities :
• Provide solid line guidance and management of across All the Service Lines that are in scope for Customer
• Ensure compliance with established standards and policies.
• Primary contact point for major program roll-outs; coordinating meetings, project activities and resources as necessary.
• Provide dotted-line guidance and leadership to indirect IT resources within assigned regions to include network, telecom, enterprise windows/storage/backup and Data centre operation support teams
• Primary interface within regional leadership for all IT Infrastructure and related activities.
• Attend regional leadership meetings providing input and guidance as required.
• Communicate openly and effectively with leadership, peers and subordinates regarding the status of open incidents, escalations, projects and IT initiatives within assigned area of responsibility.

positions.subtitle: Hewlett-Packard
positions.description: Responsible for the development and to lead on the delivery of a programme of BusinessTransformation across the Council which will comprehensively review what we do and how we do it inorder to ensure that we can continue to deliver quality front line services and maximize customersatisfaction in the most cost-effective and efficient manner.Responsibilities/Accountabilities‚Ä¢ To develop key work streams of the business transformation programme in close liaison withservice departments and other stakeholders to ensure service improvement and efficiencysavings.‚Ä¢ To advise and support, Directors and Heads of Service in undertaking Business Transformationprojects and advise on appropriate business solutions.‚Ä¢ To ensure that all business transformation projects are delivered in accordance with the corporateapproach to project management, including taking the lead on ensuring quality feasibility studies,business bases, and timelines for the evaluation of Business Transformation projects.‚Ä¢ To ensure appropriate links with other projects and strategies within the Council and ensure thatappropriate ownership is taken of risks and dependencies between projects is identified andmanaged appropriately.‚Ä¢ To develop, prepare and implement a Customer Service Strategy which will identify appropriatecustomer access, enable the monitoring of customer satisfaction and identify changes to serviceareas required to meet customer need and to coordinate the management of the delivery ofcomplex business transformation projects defined within it.To commission work where required with external suppliers and consultants; build positiverelationships; negotiate costs and control expenditure to ensure appropriate and cost effectivesolutions are introduced.‚Ä¢ To be responsible for effectively managing business transformation budgets.‚Ä¢ To manage on a day to day basis staff, contractors and consultants in line with programme andproject requirements
positions.title: Transformation Manager
positions.description_html:
Responsible for the development and to lead on the delivery of a programme of Business
Transformation across the Council which will comprehensively review what we do and how we do it in
order to ensure that we can continue to deliver quality front line services and maximize customer
satisfaction in the most cost-effective and efficient manner.
Responsibilities/Accountabilities
• To develop key work streams of the business transformation programme in close liaison with
service departments and other stakeholders to ensure service improvement and efficiency
savings.
• To advise and support, Directors and Heads of Service in undertaking Business Transformation
projects and advise on appropriate business solutions.
• To ensure that all business transformation projects are delivered in accordance with the corporate
approach to project management, including taking the lead on ensuring quality feasibility studies,
business bases, and timelines for the evaluation of Business Transformation projects.
• To ensure appropriate links with other projects and strategies within the Council and ensure that
appropriate ownership is taken of risks and dependencies between projects is identified and
managed appropriately.
• To develop, prepare and implement a Customer Service Strategy which will identify appropriate
customer access, enable the monitoring of customer satisfaction and identify changes to service
areas required to meet customer need and to coordinate the management of the delivery of
complex business transformation projects defined within it.
To commission work where required with external suppliers and consultants; build positive
relationships; negotiate costs and control expenditure to ensure appropriate and cost effective
solutions are introduced.
• To be responsible for effectively managing business transformation budgets.
• To manage on a day to day basis staff, contractors and consultants in line with programme and
project requirements

recommendations: Dr. Trilok D Singh, PhD. . ‚ÄúI am honored to provide this recommendation for Mr. Jeetesh Patel, MBA, a seasoned professional and an inspiring leader in the IT realm. Serving as the VP and Head of DataCenter at HDFC Bank Ltd, Jeetesh has showcased profound expertise in various facets of IT, especially in IT Strategy & Policy Planning, Project Management, Systems Design, and Implementation. An Engineering Graduate with an MBA, Jeetesh brings to the table over 14 years of rich cross-functional experience. His credentials are further accentuated by his recognition as the Next100- Future CIO Winner in 2015, placing him among the vanguard of Digital Transformation Leaders. His adeptness in implementing cloud solutions, including Azure, AWS, and private cloud, coupled with his deep understanding of VMWare & HyperV, makes him a force to reckon with in the IT domain. Jeetesh is a strategic visionary, always foreseeing and planning for the future, and his collaborative leadership approach ensures that his teams are cohesive, efficient, and innovative. I wholeheartedly recommend Mr. Jeetesh Patel for any top-tier leadership role in IT. His extensive experience, multifaceted expertise, and impeccable management skills position him as an ideal candidate for such roles. Wishing him continued success and accolades in his future endeavors.‚Äù

Dr. Trilok D Singh, PhD. . ‚ÄúJeetesh is an extremely dependable and devoted ITSM and PM professional. It is his hardwork and commitment that has led him to advance by leaps and bounds in his IT career. Knowledgeable, sincere, enthusiastic, clairvoyant, and a great person to be in company with. I wish him all the success and a bright future.‚Äù

detailed_profile.about: I'm a Wharton AMP alumnus and seasoned banking Tech & Fintech Expert leader with over 30 years of experience across core banking, digital strategy, and platform banking. Recognized for pioneering Open Banking architectures, modernizing core banking systems, and leading large-scale digital strategy initiatives across leading banks such as HDFC Bank, RBL Bank, and global fintech leaders like FIS. My expertise spans Core Banking Modernization, API Strategy, Payments, Digital Channels, and New Age initiatives As Founder of Pharus Consulting LLP and an Independent Director at FinVu (heading its Risk Committee), I bring a unique practitioner‚Äôs perspective to BFSI clients, helping them design, build, and execute their digital transformation journeys. I believe in combining strategic foresight with executional rigor to deliver technology with purpose and platforms with scale. Awards & Recognitions: ‚Ä¢ Women in Fintech Award ‚Äì 2019 (Fintegrate Zone) ‚Ä¢ Two-time Asian Banker Award Winner ‚Ä¢ Payments Award by IBA ‚Ä¢ Recognized contributor to the MEITY ‚ÄúReport of the Steering Committee on Fintech Related Issues‚Äù Passionate about learning and executing at scale. Believe in the power of Finternet, AI and Ecosystem Plays. At the intersection of creativity and execution Lies Innovation - In my view we are on the threshold of a tectonic shift and am looking to ride the wave both as a learner and as a leader

experience.title: Strategic Consultant - Technology
experience.description: As a founder partner of Pharus Consulting I am helping banks and Financial institutions to reimagine & modernize their core, create digital strategies that delivers value. A practitioner's view of strategy and consulting is very critical for institutions to deliver value in an uncertain and fast paced world. A consultant as a coach is critical and in many instances it is not the strategy itself but getting organizations ready for change, bringing pragmatism to execution needs experience at handling large transformationsAs a founder of a consulting company - aspiration is to bring execution strength to organisations.Currently running 2 large projects with Unity Bank, Protean e-governance

experience.description_html:
As Head of Digital and Business Solutions for HDFC Bank got an opportunity to work on large scale implementations -
Launch of cloud first customer Engagement platform – customer experience Hub
Launching multiple lending platforms especially the Consumer Durable lending platform where lending happens at the edge (at a merchant store) and delivering instant credit is critical.
Launching Vyapar – a platform for merchants – this was my first baby at HDFC Bank and so it was special in that sense – this was delivered with a startup viz. Mintoak
Working on the largest merger in the Indian Industry HDFC Bank and HDFC Ltd.
Enabling the core banking to have 5 digits – meant getting 261 systems changed to accommodate 5-digit Branch Code. The launch was spotless with zero customer impact.
Enabling more than 30 odd digital first journeys on the Adobe Platform
RBIH Initiatives
Hackathon for women - This received resounding success and we saw the value of a good low- Code No Code to enable developers across the bank's staff. Used Microsoft Power Platform for this
Close to 40 New initaitives with a team of around 600 people at its peak

detailed_profile.position: Technology Leadership @ HDFC Bank | Ex-Amazon | Professor - Senior Leader | Disruptor in data and digital transformation
detailed_profile.about: I am a serious disruptor and innovator, likes to transform the business with technology and ways of delivering it, leading from front. A technologist, architect, developer and data guy with deep roots in investment banking and Risk. I have been associated with technology around financial services & banks for more than 19 years now, with speciality in architecture and implementing large scale Risk IT Solutions. I bring in immense experience and knowledge of distributed computing architectures. Led multiple companies to enable data driven culture and bring serious technology disruptions to improve end customer experience. Experience of setting up and enabling efficient technology departments from scratch. Passionate about technologies and also writing and speaking about them in multiple forums. Visit my Blog : https://www.linkedin.com/redir/invalid-link-page?url=www%2edistributedcompute%2eblogspot%2ein Avid speaker with talks presented in multiple TechStock events on Functional Programming, BigData/ NoSQL technologies. I have strong exposure to Risk domain Banking and Financial Industry. Highly experienced in designing & implementing regulatory reporting (Consolidate Audit Trail, FRTB, BCBS 239 etc.) solutions utilizing Big Data technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Flink, Kafka, Scala etc.
